cache_content_add_entry.c

Go to the documentation of this file.

00104 #include <unistd.h>
00105 #include <sys/types.h>
00106 #include <sys/param.h>

00131 cache_content_entry_t * cache_content_new_entry( cache_entry_t                 * pentry_inode,
00132                                                  cache_content_spec_data_t     * pspecdata,
00133                                                  cache_content_client_t        * pclient,
00134                                                  cache_content_add_behaviour_t   how,
00135                                                  fsal_op_context_t             * pcontext,
00136                                                  cache_content_status_t        * pstatus ) 
00137 {
00138   cache_content_status_t    status ;
00139   cache_content_entry_t   * pfc_pentry = NULL ;
00140   int                       tmpfd ;
00141   
00142   /* Set the return default to CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS */
00143   *pstatus = CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS ;
00144   
00145   /* stat */
00146   pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_call[CACHE_CONTENT_NEW_ENTRY] += 1 ;
00147 
00148 #ifdef _DEBUG_MEMLEAKS
00149   /* For debugging memory leaks */
00150   BuddySetDebugLabel( "cache_content_entry_t" ) ;
00151 #endif
00152  
00153   if( pentry_inode == NULL ) 
00154     {
00155         *pstatus = CACHE_CONTENT_INVALID_ARGUMENT ;
00156         
00157         /* stat */
00158         pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_CONTENT_NEW_ENTRY] += 1 ;
00159 
00160         return NULL ;
00161     }
00162 
00163   if( how != RENEW_ENTRY ) 
00164    {
00165     /* Get the entry from the preallocated pool */
00166     GET_PREALLOC( pfc_pentry, 
00167                   pclient->pool_entry, 
00168                   pclient->nb_prealloc, 
00169                   cache_content_entry_t, 
00170                   next_alloc ) ;
00171 
00172 #ifdef _DEBUG_MEMLEAKS
00173     /* For debugging memory leaks */
00174     BuddySetDebugLabel( "N/A" ) ;
00175 #endif
00176     
00177   
00178     if( pfc_pentry == NULL ) 
00179        {      
00180         *pstatus = CACHE_CONTENT_MALLOC_ERROR ;
00181         
00182         DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_DEBUG, 
00183                            "cache_content_new_entry: can't allocate a new fc_entry from cache pool" ) ;
00184 
00185         /* stat */
00186         pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_CONTENT_NEW_ENTRY] += 1 ;
00187       
00188         return NULL ;
00189        } 
00190     }  /* if( how != RENEW_ENTRY ) */
00191    else
00192     {
00193         /* When renewing a file content entry, pentry_content already exists in pentry_inode, just use it */
00194         pfc_pentry = (cache_content_entry_t *)(pentry_inode->object.file.pentry_content) ;
00195     }
00196 
00197   /* Set the path to the local files */
00198   if( ( status = cache_content_create_name( pfc_pentry->local_fs_entry.cache_path_index,
00199                                             CACHE_CONTENT_INDEX_FILE,
00200                                             pcontext,
00201                                             pentry_inode, 
00202                                             pclient ) ) != CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS )
00203     {
00204       RELEASE_PREALLOC( pfc_pentry, pclient->pool_entry, next_alloc ) ;
00205 
00206       *pstatus = CACHE_CONTENT_ENTRY_EXISTS ;
00207       
00208       /* stat */
00209       pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_retryable[CACHE_CONTENT_NEW_ENTRY] += 1 ;
00210 
00211       DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_EVENT, 
00212                          "cache_content_new_entry: entry's index pathname could not be created" ) ;
00213 
00214       return NULL ;
00215     }
00216 
00217 
00218   if( ( status = cache_content_create_name( pfc_pentry->local_fs_entry.cache_path_data,
00219                                             CACHE_CONTENT_DATA_FILE,
00220                                             pcontext,
00221                                             pentry_inode, 
00222                                             pclient ) ) != CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS )
00223     {
00224       RELEASE_PREALLOC( pfc_pentry, pclient->pool_entry, next_alloc ) ;
00225 
00226       *pstatus = CACHE_CONTENT_ENTRY_EXISTS ;
00227 
00228       /* stat */
00229       pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_retryable[CACHE_CONTENT_NEW_ENTRY] += 1 ;
00230       
00231       DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_EVENT, 
00232                          "cache_content_new_entry: entry's data  pathname could not be created" ) ;
00233       
00234       return NULL ;
00235     }
00236 
00237   DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_DEBUG, "added file content cache entry: Data=%s Index=%s", 
00238                      pfc_pentry->local_fs_entry.cache_path_data, pfc_pentry->local_fs_entry.cache_path_index ) ;
00239   
00240   /* Set the sync state */
00241   pfc_pentry->local_fs_entry.sync_state = JUST_CREATED ;
00242   
00243   /* Set the internal_md */
00244   pfc_pentry->internal_md.read_time         = 0 ;
00245   pfc_pentry->internal_md.mod_time          = 0 ;
00246   pfc_pentry->internal_md.refresh_time      = 0 ;
00247   pfc_pentry->internal_md.alloc_time        = time( NULL ) ;
00248   pfc_pentry->internal_md.last_flush_time   = 0 ;
00249   pfc_pentry->internal_md.last_refresh_time = 0 ;
00250   pfc_pentry->internal_md.valid_state       = STATE_OK ;
00251  
00252   /* Set the local fd info */
00253   pfc_pentry->local_fs_entry.opened_file.local_fd  = -1 ;
00254   pfc_pentry->local_fs_entry.opened_file.last_op   =  0 ;
00255 
00256   /* Dump the inode entry to the index file */
00257   if( cache_inode_dump_content( pfc_pentry->local_fs_entry.cache_path_index, pentry_inode ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00258     {
00259 
00260       RELEASE_PREALLOC( pfc_pentry, pclient->pool_entry, next_alloc ) ;
00261       
00262       *pstatus = CACHE_CONTENT_LOCAL_CACHE_ERROR ;
00263 
00264        DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_EVENT, 
00265                           "cache_content_new_entry: entry could not be dumped in file" ) ;
00266        
00267       /* stat */
00268       pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_CONTENT_NEW_ENTRY] += 1 ;
00269       
00270       return NULL ;
00271     }
00272 
00273   /* Create the data file if entry is not recoverd (in this case, it already exists) */
00274   if( how == ADD_ENTRY || how == RENEW_ENTRY ) 
00275    {
00276      if( ( tmpfd = creat( pfc_pentry->local_fs_entry.cache_path_data, 0750 )  ) == -1 )
00277        {
00278          RELEASE_PREALLOC( pfc_pentry, pclient->pool_entry, next_alloc ) ;
00279        
00280          *pstatus = CACHE_CONTENT_LOCAL_CACHE_ERROR ;
00281    
00282           DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_EVENT, 
00283                              "cache_content_new_entry: data cache file could not be created, errno=%d (%s)", 
00284                              errno, strerror( errno ) ) ;
00285           
00286           /* stat */
00287          pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_CONTENT_NEW_ENTRY] += 1 ;
00288          
00289          return NULL ;
00290        }
00291      
00292      /* Close the new fd */
00293      close( tmpfd ) ;
00294 
00295    } /* if( how == ADD_ENTRY || how == RENEW_ENTRY ) */
00296   
00297   /* Cache the data from FSAL if there are some */
00298 
00299   /* Add the entry to the related cache inode entry */
00300   pentry_inode->object.file.pentry_content = pfc_pentry ;
00301   pfc_pentry->pentry_inode = pentry_inode ;
00302 
00303   /* Data cache is considered as more pertinent as data below in case of crash recovery */
00304   if( how != RECOVER_ENTRY ) 
00305     {
00306       /* Get the file content from the FSAL, populate the data cache */
00307       if( pclient->flush_force_fsal == 0 )
00308         cache_content_refresh( pfc_pentry, pclient, pcontext, DEFAULT_REFRESH, &status ) ;
00309       else
00310         cache_content_refresh( pfc_pentry, pclient, pcontext, FORCE_FROM_FSAL, &status ) ;
00311 
00312       if( status != CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS )
00313         {
00314           RELEASE_PREALLOC( pfc_pentry, pclient->pool_entry, next_alloc ) ;
00315 
00316           *pstatus = status ;
00317 
00318           DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_EVENT,
00319                              "cache_content_new_entry: data cache file could not read from FSAL, status=%u", status ) ;
00320                              
00321 
00322           /* stat */
00323           pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_CONTENT_NEW_ENTRY] += 1 ;
00324 
00325           return NULL ;
00326       }
00327     } /* if ( how != RECOVER_ENTRY ) */
00328 
00329   return pfc_pentry ;
00330 } /* cache_content_new_entry */
